Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Liposomal Bupivacaine in Quadratus Lumborum Block for Laparoscopic Nephrectomy

Participants.evidence: 116 patients aged 20â€“75 years undergoing elective laparoscopic nephrectomy were enrolled at Xuzhou Medical University

Intervention.evidence: 10 mL of liposomal bupivacaine (133 mg) with 10 mL saline or 20 mL of 0.375% bupivacaine hydrochloride

Objective.evidence: This trial compared the analgesic efficacy of liposomal bupivacaine versus bupivacaine hydrochloride in QLB-LSAL.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was total morphine equivalent consumption within 48 hours postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealed in opaque envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Patients, surgeons, and outcome assessors were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between January and May 2025, 116 patients were randomised: 58 to each group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The liposomal bupivacaine group had significantly lower morphine consumption (mean difference = 11.1 mg, 95% CI 10.1 to 12.1, P < 0.001)

Harms.evidence: No significant difference in adverse events was observed between groups.
